title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists

content.rendered:
What are Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists?

Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists investigate phenomena related to weather and atmosphere. They use data gathered from existing observations to prepare forecasts and other reports.

Where do Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists work?

  • Research centers
  • Government
  • Radio and television broadcasting stations

How much do Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists is $38,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Astronomy majors
  • Astrophysics majors
  • Aerospace engineering majors
Search Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientist jobs

Meteorologist and Atmospheric Space Scientist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail
  • Teamwork skills
  • Mathematical understanding and background

What are some common questions about Meteorologists and Atmospheric Space Scientists?

Q: What is a weather expert called?

A: Meteorologist.
